summary:
I'm an expert in software and service business and developed my knowledge by working in all parts of the software and service life-cycle. I have: 

- developed and grew a team of 31 Data Analysts and Data Scientists
- managed a 10MEuro research program developing IoT applications and data analytics
- performed research in service and digital transformation
- managed a consulting practice
- pitched and sold software and service in 45+ countries
- managed crisis situations as a senior recovery leader
- build and managed a support and integration team

I prefer new and emerging areas of technology and the challenges and uncertainties they come with and like to build and motivate teams to create the best outcomes for my customers.

projects.title: Presenter at Creating Value with Industrial Solutions Seminar
projects.description:
Seminar at Aalto University, Helsinki, Finland.

In their quest for differentiation, improved profitability, and competitive advantage the industrial companies are extending their current product and service-based offering with solutions businesses. However, succeeding in solutions business is challenging, requires new capabilities, deeper customer relationships, and comes with a higher cost of sales, and risks for profitability.

Service transformation - From hardware sales to revenue diversification
Manfred Dasselaar, Researcher - Service Systems Research, Ericsson

In the last 20 years Ericsson has transformed from being a company selling hardware to a company with diverse revenue streams from hardware, software and services up to the point where services is nearly 50% of total revenue. What has this journey been like and what can companies facing a similar transformation learn from it? In this presentation we discuss how to build up the organization’s capabilities, expand the offering portfolio, opportunities and challenges bringing new value propositions to market and how this now forms the basis for Ericsson’s expansion into new market segments.

projects.title: Interview on Customer Influence
projects.description:
A short interview by Inger Roos, associate professor with the Service Research Center at Karlstad University on the influence that customers and their behavior have on our business.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zRv7ZKlOXK0

projects.title: Guest lecturer at Future Networking Solutions Summer School
projects.description: Provided a guest lecture on business model innovation at the EIT ICT Labs summer school.

projects.title: Guest speaker at CTF Service Innovation Day
projects.description: I have been a guest speaker at the service innovation day organized by the Service Research Center (CTF) in Karlstad. Specific focus of this talk is the transition from product to service business and how customers can be involved in the innovation process. Click the link to see this talk on youtube.

projects.title: Guest speaker at Rotterdam School of Management corporate venturing course
projects.description: I have been a guest speaker at the corporate venturing course provided by Rotterdam School of Management. Topics addressed in my course are business model innovation and how to use experimentation when developing new business models.

projects.title: The internet of things in agriculture
projects.description: In this project, we have presented a solution for monitoring agricultural environments. The system can act as an early warning system for upcoming threats, a monitoring system constantly reporting on the status of farmland or livestock or as a recommendation system for prospective farmers. We claim that such a system is relevant in the network society and that there is sufficient technical knowledge (software and hardware components, standardized network protocols) to render its implementation not only feasible, but also cost effective.

projects.title: Panel Member at QUIS 13
projects.description: I participated in a plenary panel discussion providing a practitioner's view at he 13th international research symposium on service excellence in management

projects.title: Presenter at Euram mini-conference on management innovation
projects.description: I presented service research in a technology oriented organization as an example of management innovation.

projects.title: Discussion Panel Member at Global Investment Forum
projects.description: Panel member discussing the practitioner views of future cities and the role of technology.

projects.title: Organization of EURAM 2013 track "Service infusion in manufacturing firms: challenges for service innovation and management"
projects.description: I was part of the organizing committee of a Special Interest Group track of the EURAM 2013 conference. The track focused on service infusion in manufacturing firms which is a highly relevant topic in the time where more and more service offerings come to markets specifically enabled by cloud technology.

profile_positions.description: At ASML I was responsible for a team of 31 Data Analysts and Data Scientists who used their skills in process improvement projects. The team developed reporting, decision support and process automation solutions and translated data in concrete improvement opportunities.
profile_positions.title: Group Lead Analytics & Visualization

profile_positions.description:
As Innovation Program Manager I maximize the impact of the Research program through cocreation with relevant business accounts and/or strategic partners. 
Program Definition - I define topics within the innovation area and establish strategic direction as well as relevant value spaces in coordination with the Business whilst building a team of thought leaders in the research divisions. 
Program Execution - Ensuring the definition and execution of the transfer plan to businesses, markets and ventures. Review and track projects on their commitments and deliverables progress.
profile_positions.title: Senior Director, Innovation Program Manager Services & Analytics

profile_positions.description:
I performed research in service innovation and service marketing and developed and tested models, processes, methods and tools in order for Ericsson to create new service experiences and service solutions and also optimize service delivery. 

Research areas that I covered mainly came from marketing and strategy research and I worked e.g. with service-dominant logic, service design, servitization/service infusion, value networks, product-service systems, dynamic capabilities and organizational ambidexterity. One of the specific areas to highlight is business model innovation. When creating new services the business model helps to give a holistic perspective on the service that is developed and brings understanding to the development team from different perspectives without loosing the overview and interconnections within and outside the development team.

I applied this knowledge in technology research projects around the internet of things, data analytics and ICT Transformation in industries such as utilities, automotive, transport, agriculture and public safety.
Most of the research was performed in partnerships with Universities in Sweden, the Netherlands and the United States. I took care of initiating and managing these collaborations as well.
profile_positions.title: Service and Business Model Innovation Researcher (IoT and Data Science)

profile_positions.description:
I managed the technology consulting practice for the Western European regions. This role expanded my responsibilities in terms of the service portfolio covered but also increased revenue responsibility. Services included security consulting but also all network optimization services and programs such as the performance partnership offering (a network KPI performance based service contract).
Main activities were managing deal pipeline, supporting local sales with key deals, increase sales force portfolio knowledge and guide the introduction of new service offerings together with responsible product managers.
profile_positions.title: Practice Manager Technology Consulting Western Europe

profile_positions.description:
For two years I have been global sales manager for Ericsson's security consulting & systems integration portfolio. At the time this was an emerging area for the telecom industry since previously networks had been much more closed but the mobile internet and 3G changed this substantially. 

In this period I performed dozens of sales presentations, prepared offers and did customer contract negotiations leading to various new deals in both consulting and systems integration. 

Together with a team of consultants and solution architects we developed consulting services around regulatory and standard compliance and build the necessary solutions (e.g. implementing security controls to meet SOX requirements and ISO2700x series of standards around information security). Part of the assignment was also to train local sales personnel and improve their security skills.
profile_positions.title: Global Sales Manager Security Consulting & Systems Integration

profile_positions.description:
I was team leader of a systems integration and customer support team consisting of 30 engineers. We build this team from scratch when Multimedia Messaging was introduced in the telecommunications market and the Finnish organization was tasked with support and integration responsibilities. 

Many difficulties with the initial product meant that a lot of focus had to be put on customer support activities. This meant I took on the role of senior recovery leader as well for which I was certified in an internal certification program. The senior recovery leader is responsible to resolve customer issues from problem notification to solution. For each emergency case I established the recovery team consisting of different parts of the organization, coached and steered the team, managed customer communication, coordinated escalations and initiated improvement activities based on the problems encountered.

We turned around the early difficulties and created one of the best support and integration teams in the company.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader and Systems Expert in Systems Integration of Multimedia Messaging Systems

profile_positions.description:
I provided customer support services to telecommunications operators and designed and deployed intelligent networks services in GSM networks (such as prepaid functionality, virtual private networks, dynamic call routing and number portability). Based on the Intelligent Networks experience I then extended my responsibilities to support and integration of multimedia messaging systems (MMS). 
Customers I worked with are large telecommunications operators among which Vodafone, T-Mobile, KPN and Swisscom, Services were delivered in various countries such as the United Kingdom, Belgium, Germany, Switzerland and Norway while having my home base in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Customer Support Engineer for Intelligent Networks and Multimedia Messaging
